regularLogin.1: Think About How You Are Feeling Right Now
regularLogin.2: If you were to describe that feeling in a weather symbol, which symbol would it be?
regularLogin.3: Choose a word that best describes that feeling?
regularLogin.4: Do you want to share anything else you're feeling?

firstTimeLogin.1: This app is a tool to help you through a process of self-reflection. Will help you lead yourself through a process of self reflection to build resilience. This will be a conversation with yourselves. The more you put in the more you get out!
firstTimeLogin.2: We found that most people want to care for something other than themselves. So care for this environment by adding your daily weather
firstTimeLogin.3: Choose a word that best describes that feeling?
firstTimeLogin.4: Do you want to share anything else you're feeling?

shared.howLong: How long have you felt like this?
shared.reason: Is there anything you are aware of that has made you feel like this?
shared.positiveChange: How can you positively change your situation?
shared.anotherExercise: Do you want to do another exercise?
shared.gratefulQuestion: What are 3 things you are grateful for?
shared.takeCareQuestion: What 3 things do you do to take care of yourself to keep you well? (eg, shower etc.)
shared.likeAboutYourselfQuestion: What 3 things do you like about yourself?
shared.gratitudeReplayStatement: [CHECK THIS] Recently, you said that this makes you feel gratitude
shared.likeReplayStatement: [CHECK THIS] Recently, you said that this is something you like about yourself
shared.posReplayStatement: [CHECK THIS] Recently, you saved this as a positive memory
shared.contentReplayStatement: [CHECK THIS] Recently, you made this note
shared.reminderQuestion: Would you like to be reminded of this time in the future?
shared.photoAsk: Do you want to take a photo?

acknowledge.low: I’m sorry you are feeling like this
acknowledge.mediumLow: I’m sorry you are feeling like this
acknowledge.veryLow: I’m sorry you are feeling like this, it can be difficult to have these feelings
acknowledge.lowWithEnergy: I’m sorry you are feeling like this, it can be difficult to have these feelings
acknowledge.suicidal: I’m sorry you’re feeling like this, it can be difficult to sit with this feeling and have these feelings.

nothing: Sometimes we just have to sit with these difficult feelings, and know that they will pass, just like the weather
You are not your feelings, tomorrow will come. Just because I’m feeling nothing, doesn’t mean I am nothing

questions.posThing: What’s one small thing you can do to make yourself feel better?
questions.friendLike: What’s one thing a friend would say they like about you?

positiveStatements: A feeling is not who you are
It is ok to rest today

questions.posThing: What’s one small thing you can do to make yourself feel better?
questions.helpedCope: What things helped you cope in the past?

questions.posThing: What’s one small thing you can do to make yourself feel better?
questions.support: It can really help to get some personal or professional help on this

questions.need: What do you think you need right now?

options.crisisTeam: Call Bristol Mental Health Crisis Team: 0300 555 0334
options.ae: Ring 999 or go to A & E
options.GP: Reach out to GP / Support Worker

questions.risk: Are you at risk of harming yourself?
questions.act: Are you planning to act on that plan?
questions.pass: These feelings will pass, however it seems you need to get support now.
questions.samaritans: 999 / Samaritans. Once you've rung 999 or Samaritans it would be a good idea to ring one of your supporters to let them know what's happening.
questions.help: That's Good. Are you getting the help you need?
questions.crisis: Call crisis team. If you need a referral to the crisis team you will need to contact your GP
questions.crisis2: If the crisis team can't help immediately and you are still at risk please ring 999 or Samaritans
questions.spoken: Have you spoken to anyone about how you feel?
questions.reach: It could help to reach out to one of your anchors

onboarding.intro: Introduction to Weather Report. Introduce weather as a visual metaphor for mental health.
onboarding.bestPerson: You're the best person to understand how you're feeling. This app is a tool to help you through a process of self-reflection to build resilience. This will be a conversation with yourselves. The more you put in the more you get out!
onboarding.care: We found that most people want to care for something other than themselves. So care for this environment, by adding daily weather
onboarding.seed: Introduce Lily plant growing from seed, adding roots
onboarding.feeling: Introduction to how you are feeling and weather effect on environment

home.addToFish: Would you like to add anything to your list?
home.addToAnchors: Would you like to add an anchor?
